cast.overview: A cover-up that spanned four U.S. Presidents pushed the country's first female newspaper publisher and a hard-driving editor to join an unprecedented battle between journalist and government. Inspired by true events.
cast.title: The Post

cast.overview: When a hopelessly romantic high school senior falls for a mysterious new classmate, it sets them both on an unexpected journey that teaches them about love, loss, and most importantly themselves.
cast.title: Chemical Hearts

details.biography: Coral Peña is a Latina-American actress, and was born on March 27, 2001, in the Dominican Republic. She currently is living in Los Angeles, California; although previously she had been reported to be taking residence in New York City. She has starred in several movies, including Chemical Hearts with the role as Cora Hernandez, For All Mankind with the role as Aledia Rosales, and she even portrayed the supporting role of Nancy in the famous and acclaimed 2017 movie "The Post." In addition, she has made a variety of appearances in television too, appearing in shows such as "24: Legacy" as Marianna Stiles and in "The Enemy Within" as Anna Cruz. Her first role was in 2015 in the police drama, Blue Bloods, as Olivia Francisco.
details.name: Coral Peña
